title: About
text:
Heading-2
This is a small heading.

Heading-3
This is a much smaller heading.


Bold
This is a bold text.

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
df = sns.load_dataset("penguins")
sns.set_theme(style = "white", palette = "Pastel1")
g = sns.relplot(
data = df, 
x = "bill_length_mm", 
y = "flipper_length_mm", 
hue = "species",
col = "island",
s = 200
)
plt.setp(g._legend.get_texts(), fontsize = 18)
plt.setp(g._legend.get_title(), fontsize = 18)
for i in range(3):
    g.axes[0, i].set_xlabel("Penguin bill length (mm)", fontsize = 18) 
g.axes[0, 0].set_ylabel("Penguin flipper length (mm)", fontsize = 18)
g.axes[0, 0].set_title("Torgersen Island", fontsize = 18)
g.axes[0, 1].set_title("Biscoe Island", fontsize = 18)
g.axes[0, 2].set_title("Dream Island", fontsize = 18)
for i in range(3):
    g.axes[0, i].set_xticks([40, 50, 60])
    g.axes[0, i].set_xticklabels([40, 50, 60], fontsize = 18)
g.axes[0, 0].set_yticklabels([0, 170, 180, 190, 200, 210, 220, 230], fontsize = 18)
plt.savefig("plot-1.pdf", bbox_inches = "tight")

title: simple_quarto_website
text:
Math Equation

Inline
An allocation A is envy-free if, for every pair of agents \(i, j \in N\), it holds that


Non-inline
\[v_{i}(A_{i}) \ge v_{i}(A_{j})\]
The concept of EFX was first introduced in 1996 by Brams and Taylor(Brams and Taylor 1996), who presented an algorithm for finding an EFX allocation for divisible goods. Since then, several extensions and variations of EFX have been proposed, including those by Lipton et al. (2004)(Lipton, Markakis, and Mossel 2004).
